snippet: The New York State Racing and Wagering Board on Monday said that racetracks could not offer purses greater than twice the assigned value of the horses running in claiming races.
abstract: New York agency that oversees horse racing in the state limits the size of purses offered in races involving cheaper horses; acknowledges that fattened purses, many of them being offered at racetracks where casinos have been opened in recent years, have created a dangerous incentive to push sore or unfit horses onto the track.

byline.original: By JOE DRAPE and WALT BOGDANICH

lead_paragraph: The New York State Racing and Wagering Board on Monday said that racetracks could not offer purses greater than twice the assigned value of the horses running in claiming races.

headline.seo: New York’s Racing Board, With Eye on Horse Safety, Cuts Purses of Claiming Races
headline.main: New York Cuts Race Purses in Effort to Increase Horse Safety
